meanings.sent1: He was chousing his friends by pretending to lose the game.

meanings.sent3: The magician choused the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist was chousing people left and right with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent5: She felt betrayed when she realized her so-called friend was chousing her all along.

meanings.sent1: The tricky salesman was chousing customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent2: She choused her little brother into believing that the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat choused the dog by hiding its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox choused the farmer by stealing his chickens.
meanings.sent5: He felt foolish after being choused into thinking the fake lottery ticket was real.

meanings.sent1: The group of thieves was chousing the store owner by stealing valuable items.
meanings.sent2: She was caught chousing her way through the exam by looking at someone else's paper.
